history.content: Yes, the initial 245 seats opened for lscs/eecs seniors in 161 are already full.  If TA (gsi/ugsi) hiring proceeds as we hope, more spaces will be opened later.  At this point, all lscs/eecs students who try to enroll will be placed on the waitlist for CS161; non-majors don't yet have access even to the waitlist.

children.subject: No, I don't know when hiring will be finalized.  If you are already on the waitlist, your chances are good but the entire point of a waitlist is that it is uncertain whether you will be able to be accommodated in that particular class.  If you are uncomfortable with uncertainty, then you should drop from the waitlist and select any of the many upper div cs classes that have capacity for seniors to enroll immediately.

Is there any idea when this will be figured out? I'm a senior and I'm waitlisted for this course. I need 2 more techs to graduate and if I find out too late, there might not be anymore classes I can take.. 

I also don't want to take myself off the waitlist because I really want to take this class..
I am a eecs senior student. I got waiting listed for 161 in phase 1.
My telebears is on Friday as well... is there any possibility that the waitlist will be expanded?

While it may be possible to expand the class past 350, there are no current plans and we won't even be able to consider it until we've been able to hire enough teaching staff (gsi's) to be able to support the initially planned size of the class.  Any lscs or eecs major who wishes to use their phase 1 units should be able to waitlist the course.
Will the waitlist be manually processed based on standing, or is it FCFS?
+1, I'm EECS senior standing and just got put at position 161...given my standing/major/position, how are my odds?

+1 EECS senior standing looking to graduate in 3 years instead of 4, really wanted 161 before leaving Berkeley.

Thanks to the staff for being so responsive, any more information regarding enrollment can only help, and I understand the implications of having too little staff/too many students. If all else fails, I still want to learn security, so any resources available would be beneficial. Are there other upper divs that cover some of this stuff?

If the hiring goes well, will the class be expanded from its current size (350). I just checked the waitlist and theres already 113 on the waitlist... Assuming nobody drops, this is already full. I have my telebears on Friday and at this rate I don't think I even have a shot of getting on the waitlist. Do you think there's a good probability of the class being expanded to 500+?

There are no more available seats for anyone, all students are waitlisted at this point. Waitlists are processed pretty much in number order because telebears appointments are supposedly assigned in the order of students in special categories, graduating seniors, seniors/senior standing, juniors, and so on.

So you said "At this point, all lscs/eecs students who try to enroll will be placed on the waitlist for CS161", including juniors even though there are still available seats for them? And followup, if all students (regardless of standing) are being put on waitlist, is there standard way for processing it at that point (like seniors, then juniors, so on, or maybe some other way)?

history.content:
According to the online schedule of classes, the seats reserved for "Students with a major of COMPUTER SCIENCE or ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING AND COMPUTER SCIENCES or ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING AND COMPUTER SCIENCES AND NUCLEAR ENGIN and a class level of Senior or Senior or Senior " is full. Does this mean that even CS Majors with senior standing will be placed on the waitlist?

If no, how is it that I (CS Majors with senior standing) got placed on the waitlist during phase 1?
history.subject: CS 161 Enrollment
